author: wjmelements
content: You canâ€™t break at invalid because you can jump past it

author: chfast
content: Yes, sure. In a simple way this works if "invalid" is spotted before any jump or there is not jumpdest after the "invalid".

author: wjmelements
content: Any solidity contract with assert, such as the ones using early versions of SafeMath, will have JUMPDEST after INVALID

author: wjmelements
content: Instead of break, you should scan to the next JUMPDEST

author: chfast
content: Sorry, I confused the context. So I guess it is better to remove this check. Any reliable way of detecting the tailing data?

author: wjmelements
content: The 2byte ABI used by the top trading contracts uses dynamic jumps
